meanings.definition: To deplete the fish population in (a body of water) by excessive fishing.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman overfishes the lake, causing a decline in fish numbers.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overfish a pond to ensure a sustainable fish population.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman who overfishes the river ends up with an empty net.
meanings.sent4: Overfishing the ocean is like taking more than your fair share from a buffet.
meanings.sent5: The act of overfishing can lead to irreversible damage to aquatic ecosystems.

meanings.definition: To fish excessively in (a body of water).
meanings.sent1: He overfishes the pond every weekend, catching more fish than he needs.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen were warned not to overfish the bay to protect the marine life.
meanings.sent3: Overfishing the lake might result in the fish seeking revenge!
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was overfishing her own emotions, constantly seeking validation.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overfishing can be devastating for both the fish and the fishermen.
